Protocols/MBAudienceDelegate.html#/s:15M.name: audienceDataSent()
Protocols/MBAudienceDelegate.html#/s:15M.abstract: This function is called when audience data are sent successfully.

Protocols/MBAudienceDelegate.html#/s:15M.name: audienceDataFailed(error:)
Protocols/MBAudienceDelegate.html#/s:15M.abstract: This function is called when an error is encountered sending audience data to the server.

Classes/MBAudience.html#/s:15MBAudienceS.name: init(delegate:)
Classes/MBAudience.html#/s:15MBAudienceS.abstract: Initializes the plugin and do the startup work, increment the session and update the metadata. You can optionally pass a delegate that will be informed when the data are sent successfully or if the data sync fails.

Classes/MBAudience.html#/s:15MBAudienceS.name: setTag(_:value:)
Classes/MBAudience.html#/s:15MBAudienceS.abstract: Set the tag with a key and a value, if a tag with that key already exists its value is replaced by the new value. After setting the new tag the new audience data are sent to the server.

Classes/MBAudience.html#/s:15MBAudienceS.name: removeTag(_:)
Classes/MBAudience.html#/s:15MBAudienceS.abstract: Removes the tag with the specified key and syncs audience data with the server.

Classes/MBAudience.html#/s:15MBAudienceS.name: setCustomId(_:)
Classes/MBAudience.html#/s:15MBAudienceS.abstract: Set a custom id that will be sent with the audience data, this can be used if you want to target users coming from different platforms from MBurger. After setting this id the new audience data are sent to the server.

Classes/MBAudience.html#/s:15MBAudienceS.name: removeCustomId()
Classes/MBAudience.html#/s:15MBAudienceS.abstract: Removes the custom id and sync audience data to the server.

Classes/MBAudience.html#/s:15MBAudienceS.name: setMobileUserId(_:)
Classes/MBAudience.html#/s:15MBAudienceS.abstract: Set the mobile user id of the user currently logged in MBurger. After setting this id the new audience data are sent to the server.

Classes/MBAudience.html#/s:15MBAudienceS.name: removeMobileUserId()
Classes/MBAudience.html#/s:15MBAudienceS.abstract: Removes the mobile user id and sync audience data to the server.

Classes/MBAudience.html#/s:15MBAudienceS.name: getMobileUserId()
Classes/MBAudience.html#/s:15MBAudienceS.abstract: Retrieves the current saved mobile user id.

Classes/MBAudience.html#/s:15MBAudienceS.name: startLocationUpdates()
Classes/MBAudience.html#/s:15MBAudienceS.abstract: Start collecting location data and to send it to the server. MBAudience uses startMonitoringSignificantLocationChanges of CoreLocation with an accuracy of kCLLocationAccuracyHundredMeters. To stop collecting location data call stopLocationUpdates.

Classes/MBAudience.html#/s:15MBAudienceS.name: setCurrentLocation(latitude:longitude:)
Classes/MBAudience.html#/s:15MBAudienceS.abstract: Updates current user location with the parameters passed and calls the api to update the device data.

Classes/MBAudience.html#/s:15MBAudienceS.name: didRegisterForRemoteNotifications(withDeviceToken:)
Classes/MBAudience.html#/s:15MBAudienceS.abstract: Calling this function when your app delegate receives didRegisterForRemoteNotifications will trigger an update of the metadata, so the value of the field push_enabled will be always fresh.

Classes/MBAudience.html#/s:15MBAudienceS.name: didFailToRegisterForRemoteNotifications(withError:)
Classes/MBAudience.html#/s:15MBAudienceS.abstract: Calling this function when your app delegate receives didFailToRegisterForRemoteNotifications will trigger an update of the metadata, so the value of the field push_enabled will be always fresh.

Classes/MBAudience.html#/s:15MBAudienceS.name: delegate
Classes/MBAudience.html#/s:15MBAudienceS.abstract: The delegate of the MBAudience plugin, it will receive function calls when audience data are sent successfully or if they fail to sync with the server.

Classes/MBAudience.html.name: MBAudience
Classes/MBAudience.html.abstract: This is the plugin class for MBurger that implements the audience functionality, you can use this to target content to specific users or groups of users, based on their in app behavior. Audience data are updated at every startup, and when the app enters foreground, using the applicationWillEnterFroreground notification

Protocols/MBAudienceDelegate.html.name: MBAudienceDelegate
Protocols/MBAudienceDelegate.html.abstract: Delegate for the audience plugin, implement this method and set it to receive calls when audience data are sent successfully or if they fail to sync with the server.
